Until the disease is cured, the target can't regain hit points, and the lamasombra can sense the direction to the creature's location as long as they're on the same plane of existence.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, or 37 ({@damage 9d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage if the target is a creature who can't see the lamasombra. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, they are pulled up to 15 feet in a straight line toward the lamasombra.

bonus.name: Nightmarish Cunning
entries: The lamasombra takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Death Wail
entries: When the yumgrub dies, they let out a distressing screech. Each creature within 15 feet who can hear the yumgrub takes 1 psychic damage. Yumgrubs and creatures who have eaten a yumgrub within the last minute are immune to this damage.

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the yumgrub takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the yumgrub takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum; otherwise they take no damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The yumgrub can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Yum
entries: A Small or larger creature can use an action to consume a living yumgrub within 5 feet of them. The yumgrub dies, and for 1 minute, the consuming creature's speed is doubled and they gain a +4 bonus to their Strength score and a +2 bonus to AC. When the effect ends, the creature gains two levels of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Bite (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit -1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Utility)
headerEntries: In addition to any other spells in this stat block, the bonestalker can cast the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

trait.name: Bones of the Lost
entries: The bonestalker starts with 5 ({@dice 2d4}) skulls, which they can destroy to fuel their actions and reactions.
Choose or roll a {@dice d4} to determine each skull's creature type: 1, Beast; 2, Fey; 3, Humanoid; 4, Monstrosity.

trait.name: Skull Resistance
entries: While the bonestalker possesses at least one skull, they have advantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other supernatural effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bonestalker makes two Touch of the Felled or two Scream of the Forsaken attacks, and they can use Grief of the Bygone.

action.name: Touch of the Felled
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) necrotic damage. The bonestalker can destroy a Humanoid or Monstrosity skull to deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage to the target.

action.name: Scream of the Forsaken
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) psychic damage.

The bonestalker can destroy a Fey skull to force the target to make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition frightened} of the bonestalker until the start of the bonestalker's next turn.

action.name: Grief of the Bygone
entries: The bonestalker destroys two skulls of any type, creating a 15-foot-radius sphere of magical darkness centered on a point they can see within 60 feet of them.
The darkness spreads around corners and lasts for 1 minute.

A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and mundane light can't illuminate it. The bonestalker is unaffected by the darkness and has advantage on attack rolls against creatures in the darkness.Any creature who starts their turn in the darkness must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Power from the Conquered
entries: When the bonestalker is hit by an attack, they can destroy a Beast skull to become {@condition invisible} until the end of their next turn.

monster.name: Dancing Lady
languages: understands Druidic and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Dancing Flowers
entries: The dancing lady has three spinning flowers resembling life-sized dancing Humanoids. Each flower has AC 16, 5 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to psychic damage. Attack rolls against these whirling blooms have disadvantage. Destroying a flower deals no damage to the dancing lady, who regrows destroyed flowers at the end of their turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dancing lady makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Blood-Red Waltz
entries: For each flower the dancing lady has, they can choose one creature they can see within 60 feet of them. Each target must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw as a dancing flower sweeps toward them. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and is moved to an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the dancing lady. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't moved.

action.name: Disarming Quickstep
entries: For each flower the dancing lady has, they can choose one creature they can see within 60 feet of them. Each target must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw as a dancing flower whirls them into a dance. On a failed save, a creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) bludgeoning damage and is {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} until the start of the dancing lady's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition dazed|FleeMortals}.

action.name: Ballet of Terror (1/Day)
entries: The dancing lady's flowers pirouette and emit acrid mist. Enemies within 120 feet of the dancing lady who can smell the mist must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} of the dancing lady for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

reaction.name: Somber Dirge
entries: When a creature the dancing lady can see hits the dancing lady with an attack, the dancing lady causes the attack to hit one of their flowers instead.

trait.name: Supernatural Resistance
entries: The stag has advantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other supernatural effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stag makes three Ram or Lightburst attacks.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightburst
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) radiant damage, and the target is outlined in a golden light, giving attack rolls against them advantage until the start of the stag's next turn.

action.name: Starcall (1/Day)
entries: The stag calls down a magical shower of stars on an area that is 60 feet long and 5 feet wide within 120 feet of the stag. Each enemy in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each other willing creature in that area regains 15 hit points.

The stars then create a 10-foot-high wall of opaque radiant light in that area. Each creature in the wall's space is pushed out of it by the shortest route. The creature chooses which side of the wall to end up on. The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the stag is {@condition incapacitated} or dies. Any enemy who enters the wall of light for the first time on a turn must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Starlight Infusion
entries: The stag infuses radiant energy into a willing creature they can see within 60 feet of them. That creature deals an extra 5 radiant damage with weapon attacks until the start of the stag's next turn.

reaction.name: Nature's Ward
entries: When the stag or a creature they can see within 30 feet of them takes damage, the stag magically creates a protective barrier around that creature. The barrier reduces that damage to the protected creature by 20, then vanishes.

trait.name: Forest Rot
entries: When the rotbeast dies, they release a burst of infectious air. Each non-Fungus creature within 5 feet of them must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or gain a level of {@condition exhaustion} and become infected with forest rot disease. An infected creature regains half the normal number of hit points when they spend Hit Dice or finish a long rest, and they can't reduce their {@condition exhaustion} level by finishing a long rest.

Each time a creature with forest rot finishes a long rest, they must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains another level of {@condition exhaustion}. On a successful save, the creature loses a level of {@condition exhaustion}.
If a successful saving throw reduces the infected creature's level of {@condition exhaustion} below 1, the creature recovers from the disease.

trait.name: Rotwake
entries: When the rotbeast leaves a space, it becomes difficult terrain for creatures other than rotbeasts for 24 hours. When a non-Fungus creature enters that space for the first time on a turn or starts their turn there, they must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rotbeast makes two attacks using Weakening Horns, Rotting Hooves, or both.

action.name: Weakening Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Rotting Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or contract forest rot.

bonus.name: Healing Rot (1/Day)
entries: The rotbeast regains 3 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points for each creature within 60 feet of them infected with forest rot.

hp.special: 7 + seven times caregiver's level (number of d8 Hit Dice equal to their caregiver's level)

trait.name: Rotted Path
entries: The rotbeast and their caregiver ignore mundane difficult terrain.

action.name: Signature Attack (Horns)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 plus PB} piercing damage.

action.name: 1st Level: Tainting Attack (2 Ferocity)
entries: The rotbeast makes a signature attack. On a hit, the attack deals an extra {@damage 0d1 + PB|PB} piercing damage, and the area within 5 feet of the target becomes difficult terrain for the rotbeast's enemies until the start of the rotbeast's next turn.

action.name: 3rd Level: Rotting Hooves (5 Ferocity)
entries: The rotbeast moves up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks, then makes a signature attack. On a hit, the attack deals an extra {@damage 0d1 + PB|PB} bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 10 plus PB} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the rotbeast's next turn.

action.name: 5th Level: Rotwake Charge (8 Ferocity)
entries: The rotbeast moves up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks, tainting the ground beneath their hooves and making it mundane difficult terrain for their enemies until the start of the rotbeast's next turn. During this move, the rotbeast can move through the space of Large or smaller creatures as if they were difficult terrain. When a creature enters tainted ground for the first time on a turn or starts their turn there, they must make a {@dc 10 plus PB} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage PBd8} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Ashen Hoarder
languages: understands the languages of their creator but can't speak

trait.name: Corpse Carrier
entries: The hoarder carries 6 ({@dice 1d6 + 3}) corpses, which they can use with Corpse Bomb and Create Zombies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hoarder makes two Arm attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature, they can use Impale on the target.

action.name: Arm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (hoarder's choice).

action.name: Impale
entries: The hoarder attempts to impale one Larger or smaller creature they can see within 10 feet of them on their spikes. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) piercing damage and be {@condition restrained}. A creature {@condition restrained} in this way takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage at the start of each of their turns, and if this damage reduces them to 0 hit points, they die and become an additional corpse for the hoarder's Corpse Carrier. A creature can use their action to make a {@dc 17} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, and on a success, they free themself or a creature within reach who is {@condition restrained} by the hoarder. If the hoarder is destroyed, each creature {@condition restrained} by them is freed.

action.name: Corpse Bomb
entries: The hoarder hurls a corpse up to 60 feet, destroying it and releasing necrotic energy in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the corpse. Each creature in this area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of the hoarder's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't prevented from regaining hit points.

bonus.name: Create Zombies
entries: The hoarder drops any number of corpses from their Corpse Carrier. Each dropped corpse rises as a zombie in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of the hoarder and takes their turn immediately after the hoarder's.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ooze remains motionless, they are indistinguishable from a pool of blood.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature who isn't a Construct or an Undead, they must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or the ooze melds into the target's body.
While inside a creature, the ooze has total cover against attacks and other effects originating outside that host.

If the host creature takes 5 damage or more on a single turn from a source other than the ooze, the ooze must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or exit the host, entering the nearest unoccupied space of the ooze's choice. A {@psionic cure ailment|TalPsi} power, {@spell protection from poison} spell, or {@spell lesser restoration} spell cast on the host also forces the ooze out. By spending 5 feet of their movement, the ooze can voluntarily leave the host's body.

action.name: Crimson Feast (Inside Host Only)
entries: The ooze consumes their host creature's bodily fluids. The host must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the host takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, the host takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Incorporeal Cloud
entries: The haunt can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. In addition, the haunt can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain.
The haunt takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if they end their turn inside an object.

trait.name: Invisibility
entries: The haunt is {@condition invisible}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The haunt makes two Spectral Wrath attacks.

action.name: Spectral Wrath
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the haunt's space. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Wave of Despair {@recharge 5}
entries: The haunt unleashes a wave of psychic pain. Each enemy within 20 feet of the haunt must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Possess Object
entries: The haunt can magically manipulate a Large or smaller object within 30 feet of them that isn't being worn or carried by another creature. The haunt can exert fine control on objects under their control, such as playing piano keys, slamming doors, opening windows, or writing with a quill.

As part of this bonus action, the haunt can hurl the object up to 30 feet in any direction or use it as a ranged weapon to attack one creature within 30 feet of the object. The object has a +8 bonus to hit and deals 15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage on a hit. The GM might rule that a specific object deals piercing or slashing damage based on its form.

action.name: Necrotic Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) necrotic damage, or 13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) necrotic damage if the target can't see the lightthief.

action.name: Into the Light {@recharge}
entries: The lightthief teleports inside a light source they can see within 15 feet of them that is emitting bright or dim light. While inside the light source, the lightthief has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the light source. If the light source is extinguished by any means other than the lightthief's Steal Light action, the lightthief is forced out, appears in an unoccupied space of their choice within 5 feet of the light source, and is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Steal Light (Inside Light Source Only)
entries: The lightthief can cause the light they are inside to erupt in a burst of brilliant radiance. Each creature within 15 feet of the light source must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage and loses any darkvision they have for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't lose their darkvision. After this, the light source extinguishes and the lightthief appears in an unoccupied space of their choice within 5 feet of the light source.

hp.special: 6 + six times caregiver's level (number of d8 Hit Dice equal to their caregiver's level)

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Signature Attack (Pseudopod)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 plus PB} bludgeoning damage.

action.name: 1st Level: Distracting Attack (2 Ferocity)
entries: The ooze makes a signature attack. On a hit, the attack deals its normal effects, and the next attack made against the target before the start of the ooze's next turn has advantage.

action.name: 3rd Level: Clever Goop (5 Ferocity)
entries: The ooze takes the Hide action and makes a signature attack (in either order). If the attack hits a Large or smaller creature, the target is knocked {@condition prone}. While the ooze is hidden in this way, they can approach a creature or move where they're clearly visible without automatically giving away their position.

action.name: 5th Level: Crimson Feast (8 Ferocity)
entries: The ooze attempts to enter the body of a creature they can see within 5 feet of them who isn't a Construct or an Undead. The target must make a {@dc 10 plus PB} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the ooze melds into the target, who takes {@damage PBd6} necrotic damage, becomes the ooze's host, and is {@condition poisoned} until the ooze exits the host.
While melded, the ooze has total cover against attacks and other effects originating outside the host, and they can't take any action except to exit the host as a bonus action.

At the start of each of the ooze's turns, the host must make a {@dc 10 plus PB} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the host takes {@damage PBd6} necrotic damage and remains melded. On a successful save, the host takes half as much damage and the ooze exits the host. If the host dies or is subject to a {@psionic cure ailment|TalPsi} power, a protection from poison or {@spell lesser restoration} spell, or a similar supernatural effect, the ooze exits the host.
When the ooze exits the host, they enter an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the host.

bonus.name: Parasitic Symbiosis
entries: If the ooze's caregiver is within 5 feet of them, the ooze moves inside their caregiver. While inside their caregiver, the ooze has total cover against attacks and other effects originating outside the caregiver. The ooze can exit the caregiver by using another bonus action, entering an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the caregiver.

bonus.name: Quick Cure (1/Day)
entries: While inside their caregiver (see Parasitic Symbiosis), the ooze cleanses their caregiver's blood, ending the {@condition paralyzed} and {@condition poisoned} conditions on the caregiver.

monster.name: Ankheg

trait.name: Disoriented Resistance (2/Day)
entries: When the ankheg fails a saving throw, they can succeed instead, and they can't use bonus actions until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Earth Walk
entries: Difficult terrain composed of earth and stone doesn't cost the ankheg extra movement.

trait.name: Soft Underbelly
entries: When a {@condition prone} creature within 5 feet of the ankheg attacks the ahkheg, the attack is made with advantage instead of disadvantage.

trait.name: Unstable Tunneler
entries: While burrowing, the ankheg leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in their wake. Each section of tunnel collapses 1 minute after the ahkheg leaves that space.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage. If the target is Large or smaller, they are {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the ankheg can't make a Bite attack against another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Acid Spit {@recharge}
entries: The ankheg spits acid in a 30-foot long, 5-foot-wide line. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage and is bathed in acid. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

A creature who is bathed in acid takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). A creature can use their action to wipe the acid off themself or another creature within their reach, ending the effect early.

bonus.name: Earth Eruption
entries: While burrowing within 10 feet of the surface, the ankheg erupts (without spending movement) into a 10-foot square on the ground directly above them. This area becomes difficult terrain, and each creature on the ground in this area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is pushed 5 feet to an unoccupied space of the ankheg's choice and is {@condition restrained} by rubble. A creature can use their action to free themself or another creature within their reach. On a successful save, a creature is moved 5 feet to an unoccupied space of the creature's choice and is not {@condition restrained}.

reaction.name: Skitter
entries: When a creature attacks the ankheg, the ankheg can move up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendaryHeader: The ankheg has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy's turn. The ankheg can take these actions in any order but can use only one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Big Bug!
entries: The ankheg stands on their hind legs in an impressive and terrifying display of dominance. Each enemy within 30 feet of the ankheg who can see them must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the ankheg for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

legendary.name: Action 2: Quick Burrow
entries: If the ankheg is {@condition grappled}, the condition ends for them, and they burrow up to twice their speed without provoking opportunity attacks. If the ankheg is grappling a Large or smaller creature during this movement, the ankheg's speed is not halved.

legendary.name: Action 3: Acid Bath
entries: Acid sprays from the ankheg's wounds onto each creature within 15 feet of them. Each target must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Bredbeddle
senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius in true form)

trait.name: Headless (True Form Only)
entries: The bredbeddle can't be {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the bredbeddle dies, they return to life in {@dice 1d6} months with all their hit points. If their body was destroyed, it reforms in an unoccupied space nearest to where they died. Only a {@spell wish} spell or finding and destroying the bredbeddle's true head can prevent this trait from functioning.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bredbeddle makes two Executioner's Axe attacks.

action.name: Executioner's Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Beheading Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one Large or smaller Giant or Humanoid with a head. {@h}40 ({@damage 6d10 + 7}) slashing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the bredbeddle cuts off the target's head, which lands at the target's feet. A creature beheaded in this way remains alive unless reduced to 0 hit points, but they are {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}, and they can't speak. A creature can use an action to place a beheaded creature's head back on their neck, reattaching the head and ending the effect. A beheaded creature dies if they are separated from their head for more than 24 hours.

bonus.name: Get a Head
entries: The bredbeddle picks up a severed Giant or Humanoid head within 15 feet of them and places it on the bredbeddle's neck. The bredbeddle then polymorphs into that Giant or Humanoid creature. While polymorphed, the bredbeddle's statistics change as follows:

items: They can speak.
They lose their Headless trait.
Their size changes to match the creature whose head they bear.
They can see normally, and they gain any special senses the creature's head had.
Any equipment they are wearing or carrying temporarily changes to match their size, but the equipment's statistics do not change.

entries: The bredbeddle reverts to their true form if they die, if their head is removed, or after 24 hours. When they revert, the head falls off and can't be reattached to the bredbeddle.
A creature who can reach the bredbeddle can use an action to make a {@dc 18} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, removing the head from the bredbeddle on a success.

bonus.name: Toss Head (Polymorphed Form Only)
entries: The bredbeddle removes their head, reverting to their true form, and throws the head at a creature they can see within 60 feet of them.
The head lands in the target's space, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the willow remains motionless, they are indistinguishable from a normal willow tree.

trait.name: Flammable
entries: If the willow takes fire damage, they catch fire and take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute. The effect ends early if the willow takes cold damage or a creature uses an action to extinguish the flames.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The willow makes two Frenzied Branch attacks.

action.name: Frenzied Branch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the willow is on fire, this attack deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Tugging Roots
entries: Roots erupt from a point on the ground the willow can see within 60 feet of them. Each creature in a 10-foot sphere centered on that point must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and moved up to 30 feet toward the willow, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet moved.

action.name: Willow's Tears
entries: The willow showers salty droplets on their bower. Each creature within 15 feet of the willow must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the willow (save ends at end of turn). While {@condition charmed} in this way, a creature can't willingly move more than 15 feet away from the willow. If a creature {@condition charmed} in this way takes damage, the effect ends for them.

reaction.name: Tree Transformation
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the willow deals slashing damage to the willow, the willow attempts to turn the creature into a tree. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or their feet begin to transform into tree roots and they are {@condition restrained}. A creature {@condition restrained} in this way must repeat the saving throw at the end of their next turn. On a successful save, the effect ends. On a failed save, they are transformed into a wooden tree and are {@condition petrified}. A creature {@condition petrified} in this way resembles a normal tree of the same size as that creature, except the creature's face appears carved into the trunk. If the willow dies, the petrification ends and the creature reverts to their true form. A {@psionic cure ailment|TalPsi} power or {@spell lesser restoration} spell also ends this effect.

trait.name: Obscuring Form
entries: Other creatures in the swarm's space are {@condition blinded}.

trait.name: Shrink
entries: When the swarm is reduced to half their hit points, their size becomes Large.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: The swarm has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes three Flutter Cutter attacks.

action.name: Flutter Cutter
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) slashing damage, or 33 ({@damage 8d6 + 5}) slashing damage if the target is a Construct made of stone or is holding or wearing an object that emits bright light.

bonus.name: Devour Stone
entries: The swarm feeds on a mundane object or structure within 5 feet of them that is made mostly of stone.
If the swarm targets a Medium or smaller object, it is entirely devoured. If the swarm targets a structure or a Large or larger object, the swarm devours a 5-foot-cube portion of it.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the lacuna is subjected to an effect that allows them to make a saving throw to take only half damage, they instead take no damage if they succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if they fail.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the lacuna remains motionless, they are indistinguishable from a normal statue.

trait.name: Fiend Between
entries: The lacuna doesn't have a walking speed and can't benefit from any bonus to their speed.

trait.name: Supernatural Resistance
entries: The lacuna has advantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other supernatural effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lacuna makes three Grief-Eater attacks and uses Infuse Sadness, if available.

action.name: Grief-Eater
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20 ft., one creature. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) psychic damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Infuse Sadness (1/Day)
entries: Each enemy the lacuna can see within 30 feet of them must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be overwhelmed with grief for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). While a creature is overwhelmed, attacks against them are made with advantage.

bonus.name: Slip Between
entries: The lacuna teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

reaction.name: Slip Away
entries: When a creature within 60 feet of the lacuna targets them with an attack, the lacuna teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space they can see. If the lacuna is no longer a valid target for the triggering attack, the attacker must choose a new target or the attack misses.

trait.name: Corpse Retreat (1/Day)
entries: The thornblood is a mass of thick, thorny vines that grow from a Medium humanoid corpse. When the thornblood is reduced to 0 hit points, they are reduced to 1 hit point instead and retreat into the corpse that grew them.

The thornblood becomes immune to all damage until the end of their next turn. Additionally, until the thornblood finishes a long rest, their size becomes Medium, their walking and climbing speeds become 60 feet, and they can't make Throttle attacks or benefit from the Overgrowth trait.

trait.name: Overgrowth
entries: The thornblood can move their vines through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. The thornblood can occupy another creature's space and vice versa.

trait.name: Supernatural Resistance
entries: The thornblood has advantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other supernatural effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thornblood makes four attacks using Vinerip, Throttle, or both.

action.name: Vinerip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) piercing damage, and the target is pulled up to 30 feet toward the thornblood.

action.name: Throttle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the thornblood's space. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) piercing damage, and the tar get is entangled in thorny vines. While entangled, the target is {@condition restrained} and moves with the thornblood, can't see outside their space, and takes 20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) piercing damage at the start of each of their turns. The target or another creature within 5 feet of them can use their action to take 20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) slashing damage and make a {@dc 20} Strength check, freeing the target on a success.

action.name: From Life, Lightning (2/Day)
entries: The thornblood must have at least one creature entangled to use this action. Each creature entangled by the thornblood must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Then the thornblood shoots a bolt of lightning at each enemy within 60 feet of them who isn't entangled by them. Each target must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: You're Mine
entries: The thornblood moves an entangled creature to a space occupied by the thornblood that isn't also occupied by another creature or object.

reaction.name: Hostile Roots
entries: When an enemy ends their turn in the thornblood's space, the thornblood attempts to pull them down. The target must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Antimagic Lethargy
entries: While in the area of an {@spell antimagic field} spell, the amalgam's speed is halved and they can't use reactions. Additionally, if targeted by the {@spell dispel magic} spell, the amalgam must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or be unable to use reactions for 1 minute.

trait.name: Arcane Tracker
entries: If the amalgam comes within 30 feet of a creature or object affected by magic, the amalgam can unerringly track that target for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Explosive Enhancement
entries: After the amalgam is hit with an attack using a mundane melee weapon, that weapon becomes charged with vibrating energy. For the next minute, the weapon gains a cumulative +1 bonus to damage rolls. If this bonus increases to +3, the weapon explodes and is destroyed, and the creature wielding it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) force damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the amalgam remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a puddle of muck.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The amalgam can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the amalgam can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. The amalgam can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The arcane amalgam makes two Bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage if the amalgam has half their hit points or fewer.

action.name: Wild Surge {@recharge 5}
entries: The unstable compounds that form the amalgam react violently to each other. Each creature within 10 feet of the amalgam must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) damage of a random type (roll a {@dice d6} for each creature): 1, acid; 2, cold; 3, fire; 4, force; 5, necrotic; 6, poison. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

reaction.name: Spell Reflection
entries: When the amalgam takes damage from a spell, they emit a burst of magical energy. Each creature within 10 feet of the amalgam must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) damage of the type dealt to the amalgam by the triggering spell. If the spell dealt more than one type of damage, the amalgam chooses which type this reaction deals.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The isopod can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: The isopod has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks to hide in rocky terrain.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Seize
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the isopod can't make a Seize attack against another target.

reaction.name: Curl
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the isopod hits them with an attack, the isopod defensively rolls up inside their rocky carapace. The isopod gains a +2 bonus to AC against the triggering attack, and the attacker must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage and be pushed 5 feet into an unoccupied space of the isopod's choice.

trait.name: Acid Absorption
entries: Whenever the valochera is subjected to acid damage, they take no damage and instead regain a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

trait.name: Unbearable Stench
entries: Any creature who starts their turn within 5 feet of the valochera must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The valochera makes two Mycelium attacks.

action.name: Mycelium
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller, they are {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}).
Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Chow Time
entries: The valochera douses a creature they have {@condition grappled} with acid and then takes a bite. The target must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) acid damage plus 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Poison Glob {@recharge 5}
entries: The valochera spits a glob of noxious sludge at a point they can see within 30 feet of them.

Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

hp.special: 7 + seven times caregiver's level (number of d8 Hit Dice equal to their caregiver's level)

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The isopod can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: The isopod has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

action.name: Signature Attack (Bite)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 plus PB} piercing damage.

action.name: 1st Level: Mangling Attack (2 Ferocity)
entries: The isopod makes a signature attack. On a hit, the target's speed is also reduced by 10 feet until the end of the isopod's next turn.

action.name: 3rd Level: Push Through (5 Ferocity)
entries: The isopod moves up to their walking speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

While doing so, they can move through the spaces of Large or smaller creatures as if they were difficult terrain. If the isopod enters another creature's space during this move, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 10 plus PB} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: 5th Level: Tackle (8 Ferocity)
entries: The isopod moves up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks and makes a signature attack. On a hit, the target is also {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 10 plus PB}). While {@condition grappled} in this way, the target is {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} and {@condition restrained}.

reaction.name: Emergency Hug (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When the isopod's caregiver is hit with an attack while within 5 feet of the isopod, the isopod curls around the caregiver, giving the caregiver a +PB bonus to their AC against the attack.

monster.name: Bog Body
languages: understands the languages they knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Acidic Blood
entries: A creature who deals piercing or slashing damage to the bog body while within 5 feet of them takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, they are {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the bog body can't make a Slam attack against another target.

action.name: Sling Mud
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Submerge
entries: If the bog body is in swampy terrain, they can submerge themself beneath the water and mud. While submerged, the bog body is heavily obscured.

If the bog body is grappling a target when they submerge, the target submerges with them. While submerged, the target is heavily obscured, {@condition restrained}, and unable to breathe, and takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage at the start of each of their turns.
A bog body can resurface as a bonus action. When they do so, a target they have {@condition grappled} also resurfaces.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The marsh hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition dazed|FleeMortals}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Roll Over
entries: If the marsh hydra moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits them with an Entangling Serpents attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marsh hydra makes two Entangling Serpents attacks. They can replace one attack with a Many Bites attack.

action.name: Entangling Serpents
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}).

action.name: Many Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of the marsh hydra's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

bonus.name: Serpent Surprise
entries: The marsh hydra activates one of the following effects; if the effect targets another creature, the marsh hydra targets one creature they can see within 30 feet of them:

items.name: 1. Poison Spit
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage and be {@condition blinded} until the end of the marsh hydra's next turn.

items.name: 2. Entrancing Gaze
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the marsh hydra for 1 minute or until the marsh hydra harms the target (save ends at end of turn).

items.name: 3. Terrifying Rattle
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} by the marsh hydra for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

items.name: 4. Reinforcements
entries: The marsh hydra shuffles which heads are on the outside of their body and regains 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points.

monster.name: Rot Angel
languages: understands Celestial but can't speak it

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The angel doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when they fly out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Decaying Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage, or if the target is a corpse or Undead, the damage increases to 36 ({@dice 8d8}).

Additionally, for the next 24 hours, the target is marked for death. A creature who drops to 0 hit points while marked for death immediately fails one death saving throw. This effect isn't cumulative.

bonus.name: Hypnotic Beam
entries: One of the angel's eyes shoots a magic ray at a creature the angel can see within 60 feet of them. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or use their reaction, if available, to move as far as their speed allows toward the angel, avoiding obviously dangerous ground.

reaction.name: Radiant Puff
entries: When the angel is hit with an attack, they release a cloud of spores. Each creature within 10 feet of the angel must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the rot angel's next turn.

monster.name: Swamp Dryad
languages: any languages the dryad spoke before their binding

trait.name: Supernatural Resistance
entries: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against supernatural effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The dryad can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Tree Stride (1/Turn)
entries: The dryad can use 10 feet of movement to step into one living tree within their reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or larger.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dryad makes two Slam attacks and uses Entangling Roots, if available.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Entangling Roots {@recharge 5}
entries: The dryad chooses a point they can see within 60 feet of them, causing tree roots to pull free of the ground and attack in a 15-foot radius centered on that point. If the dryad is within 5 feet of their tree, the radius of this effect doubles to 30 feet. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).
While {@condition grappled} in this way, a creature is {@condition restrained} and their flesh begins to harden and turn to wood.

At the end of a creature's third consecutive turn being {@condition grappled} in this way, they become {@condition petrified} and turn into a hardwood statue. The {@condition petrified} condition ends for that creature if the dryad uses an action to end it, or if the dryad dies.

action.name: Fey Intimidation
entries: The dryad targets up to five creatures they can see within 30 feet of them. Each target who can see the dryad must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the dryad (save ends at end of turn). If a target succeeds on their saving throw or the effect ends for them, the target is immune to the swamp dryad's Fey Intimidation for the next 24 hours.

bonus.name: Swamp Medicine (3/Day)
entries: The dryad touches a creature, who regains 18 ({@dice 3d8 + 5}) hit points. Alternatively, the creature removes one disease or neutralizes one poison afflicting them.

trait.name: Psionic Shroud
entries: The dreamer is immune to divination spells and to any effect that would sense their emotions or read their thoughts.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dreamer makes two Tendrils attacks and uses Dream Spores, if available.

action.name: Tendrils
entries: {@atk mp} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage. If the target is {@condition charmed} by the dreamer, the dreamer regains hit points equal to half the psychic damage dealt.

action.name: *Dream Spores (5th-Order Power; Recharge 5-6)
entries: The dreamer releases a cloud of psionic spores. Each creature within 60 feet of them must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the dreamer for 1 minute.
While {@condition charmed} in this way, a creature must use their movement during their turn to move within 10 feet of the dreamer by the safest available route.
A creature {@condition charmed} in this way can repeat the saving throw whenever they take damage, ending the effect on themself on a success.

reaction.name: Rouse Dreamer
entries: When a creature makes an attack against the dreamer, the dreamer chooses a creature {@condition charmed} by the dreamer within the attack's range, and the {@condition charmed} creature becomes the target of the attack instead.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The gem jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the jelly remains motionless, they are indistinguishable from a natural crystal formation.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gem jelly makes two Pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod (True Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Crystalline Shatter (Crystalline Form Only)
entries: The jelly shatters their hardened outer layer, returning to their true form and sending crystal shrapnel in all directions. Each creature within 10 feet of the gem jelly must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Gem jellies are immune to this damage.

bonus.name: Harden
entries: The gem jelly transforms into a psionically hardened crystalline form or back into their true form. While in crystalline form, the jelly's AC increases to 20, their speed becomes 0, they can't make Pseudopod attacks, they have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and they gain vulnerability to thunder damage.

reaction.name: Reactive Shatter (Crystalline Form Only)
entries: When the jelly takes thunder damage, they use Crystalline Shatter.

trait.name: Supernatural Resistance
entries: The leyleech has advantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other supernatural effects.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature who can cast spells, the leyleech chooses one of the target's spellcasting abilities. That ability score is reduced by 1 (min- imum score of 1) until the target finishes a short or long rest, and the leyleech's form becomes charged for 1 minute or until they use Magic Purge.

action.name: Magic Purge (Charged Form Only)
entries: The leyleech spews corrupted magical energy at a creature they can see within 30 feet of them. The leyleech is no longer charged, and the target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Scent Reliance
entries: The marvorok can't use their blindsight if they can't breathe or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marvorok makes three Claw attacks and one Eviscerate attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, they are {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The marvorok can grapple up to two creatures at a time.

action.name: Eviscerate
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature {@condition grappled} by the marvorok. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Taste the Air
entries: The marvorok makes a Wisdom (Percep- tion) check.

bonus.name: Underground Stalker
entries: The marvorok teleports, along with any creatures they are grappling, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space they can see. If the marvorok teleports into an area of dim light or darkness, they can take the Hide action as part of this bonus action, and any creatures they are grappling can't speak or make noise until the end of the marvorok's next turn.

hp.special: 8 + eight times caregiver's level (number of d8 Hit Dice equal to their caregiver's level)

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the jelly remains motionless, they are indistinguishable from a natural crystal formation.

trait.name: Flowing Jelly
entries: The jelly can occupy their caregiver's space and vice versa, and it doesn't count as difficult terrain for them.
While occupying the same space as the jelly, the caregiver can take the Hide action to hide from creatures outside the jelly.

action.name: Signature Attack (Pseudopod)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 plus PB} piercing damage.

action.name: 1st Level: Stretch Attack (2 Ferocity)
entries: The jelly makes a signature attack with a reach of 10 feet. On a hit, the attack deals an extra {@damage 0d1 + PB|PB} damage, and the jelly can pull the target 5 feet toward them.

action.name: 3rd Level: Crystallize (5 Ferocity)
entries: The jelly grows sharp crystals from the ground in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the jelly. Until the start of the jelly's next turn, that area becomes difficult terrain for their enemies, and when an enemy moves into or within that area, the enemy takes 2 × PB piercing damage for every 5 feet they travel.

action.name: 5th Level: Shatter (8 Ferocity)
entries: The jelly ejects jagged crystals from their body toward each enemy within 10 feet of them.
Each target must make a {@dc 10 plus PB} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage PBd6} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

hp.special: 7 + seven times caregiver's level (number of d8 Hit Dice equal to their caregiver's level)

action.name: Signature Attack (Bite)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d6 plus PB} piercing damage.

action.name: 1st Level: Sparking Attack (2 Ferocity)
entries: The leyleech makes a signature attack. On a hit, the attack deals an extra {@damage 0d1 + PB|PB} damage, and if the target hits the leyleech with an attack before the start of the leyleech's next turn, the target takes PB lightning damage.

action.name: 3rd Level: Anomalous Terrain (5 Ferocity)
entries: The area within 10 feet of the leyleech becomes difficult terrain for their enemies until the start of their next turn. When an enemy enters that area for the first time on a turn or starts their turn there, they must succeed on a {@dc 10 plus PB} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage PBd4} force damage.

action.name: 5th Level: Magic Purge (8 Ferocity)
entries: The leyleech spews corrupted magical energy at a creature they can see within 30 feet of them. The target must make a {@dc 10 plus PB} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage PBd8} force damage and is {@condition dazed|FleeMortals} until the start of the leyleech's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition dazed|FleeMortals}.

reaction.name: Absorb Magic (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When the leyleech's caregiver is within 30 feet of them and the leyleech or their caregiver is affected by a spell of 3rd level or lower, the leyleech consumes the spell's magic, and it has no effect on the leyleech and their caregiver.

trait.name: Aura of Command
entries: Halorin and any Undead within 30 feet of him have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn Undead.

trait.name: Pendant of Grave Regeneration
entries: Halorin regains 5 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Halorin makes one Shield Slam attack and one Mace attack. If he hits the same creature with both attacks, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than Halorin until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shield Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Unyielding Protection
entries: When a willing ally within 5 feet of Halorin is hit by an attack, he swaps places with that creature without provoking opportunity attacks and is hit by the attack instead. To use this reaction, Halorin must be able to see the ally and the attacker.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Utility)
headerEntries: In addition to any other spells in this stat block, Lestheris can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

trait.name: Charm Resistant
entries: Lestheris has advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on herself.

trait.name: Dark Calling
entries: Each other creature within 30 feet of Lestheris has disadvantage on death saving throws.

trait.name: Tome of the Ethereal
entries: Lestheris can see 120 feet into the Ethereal Plane.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Lestheris makes two Grave Grasp or two Necrotic Lance attacks.

action.name: Grave Grasp (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of Lestheris's next turn.

action.name: Necrotic Lance (1st-Level Spell)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.
Lestheris can destroy a shade under her control within 30 feet of her and deal an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage to the target.

action.name: Animate Spirits (2/Day)
entries: Lestheris animates two shades.

The shades appear in unoccupied spaces Lestheris can see within 30 feet of her. The shades act immediately after Lestheris on the same initiative count and follow her verbal orders. If Lestheris dies, the shades are destroyed.

reaction.name: Ethereal Step (3/Day)
entries: When a creature Lestheris can see within 60 feet of her targets her with an attack, power, or spell while she isn't on the Ethereal Plane, she can choose one of the following effects:

items: Lestheris enters the Ethereal Plane, then returns to the plane and the space she left at the start of her next turn.

entries: If that space is occupied, she returns to the nearest unoccupied space of her choice.
• She teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Utility)
headerEntries: In addition to any other spells in this stat block, Jedar can cast the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

trait.name: Exploit Opening (3/Day)
entries: When Jedar makes an attack, he has advantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Nameless Reach (2/Day; 1st-Level Spell)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of Jedar's next turn has advantage.

action.name: Animate Bones (1/Day)
entries: Jedar animates three {@creature decrepit skeleton|FleeMortals}s, who appear in unoccupied spaces Jedar can see within 30 feet of him. The skeletons act immediately after Jedar on the same initiative count and follow his verbal orders.
If Jedar dies, the skeletons are destroyed.

bonus.name: Bone Shield
entries: Jedar destroys a decrepit skeleton under his control and chooses a creature he can see within 60 feet of him. The target gains 7 ({@dice 2d6}) temporary hit points.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Utility)
headerEntries: In addition to any other spells in this stat block, Mycete can cast the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

3: {@spell locate animals or plants} {@sup {@cite Casting Times|FleeMortals|A}}

trait.name: Necrotic Absorption
entries: Whenever Mycete is subjected to necrotic damage, she takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Parasitic Spores
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, Mycete regains 3 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points.

action.name: Fungal Growth
entries: Mycete causes fungi to proliferate from a point she can see within 60 feet of her. Solid surfaces in a 10-foot square centered on that point become difficult terrain, and a creature who enters that area for the first time on a turn or starts their turn there must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

action.name: Animate Husks (1/Day)
entries: Mycete animates three rotting zombies, who appear in unoccupied spaces Mycete can see within 30 feet of her. The zombies act immediately after Mycete on the same initiative count and follow her verbal orders. If Mycete dies, the zombies are destroyed.

bonus.name: Spore Eruption
entries: Mycete destroys a rotting zombie under her control, and the zombie violently erupts with toxic spores.
Each enemy within 5 feet of the zombie must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Dying Gasp
entries: When the Horror dies, they begin to rupture in a vile explosion of viscera and necrotic energy. The creature who reduced the Horror to 0 hit points can make a {@dc 15} Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check to appeal to Elyas's departing soul (no action required). On a successful check, his soul transforms the explosion and each enemy of the Grave Order within 30 feet of the Horror gains 7 ({@dice 2d6}) temporary hit points. On a failed check (or if no check is made), each creature within 15 feet of the Horror must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spine Cleaver
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage against a {@condition grappled} target.

action.name: Bone Hook
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 15 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, they are {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) and the Horror can pull the target up to 15 feet toward them.
Until this grapple ends, the Horror can't make a Bone Hook attack against another target.

bonus.name: Valor's Death
entries: Each enemy within 10 feet of the Horror who can hear the Horror must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the Horror for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn). If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for them, the creature is immune to the Horror's Valor's Death for 24 hours.

trait.name: Boog Rampage
entries: If Boog sees another Abomination reduced to 0 hit points, Boog rampages for 1 minute. While rampaging, Boog's melee attacks deal an extra 2 damage.

trait.name: Boog Charge
entries: If Boog moves at least 10 feet straight toward a Medium or smaller creature and then hits them with a Gore attack on the same turn, the target is impaled on Boog's horn and is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). While {@condition grappled} in this way, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage at the start of each of their turns, and Boog can't make a Gore attack against another target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Boog makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage or 12 ({@dice 1d10 + 7}) if rampaging.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage or 10 ({@dice 1d6 + 7}) if rampaging.

action.name: Boog's Ball
entries: Boog throws a 3-inch-radius magic ball at a point they can see within 60 feet of them. If that point is 30 feet or less from Boog, the ball grows to a 5-foot radius. If that point is more than 30 feet from Boog, the ball grows to a 10-foot radius. Each creature in the ball's area when it reaches that point must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage. After the ball reaches that point, it shrinks back to its 3-inch radius and teleports into the hand Boog used to throw it.

trait.name: Octopodan Camouflage
entries: Ceemal can attempt to hide even when they are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, or other natural phenomena.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ceemal makes two Fillet Knife or two Acid Spit attacks.

action.name: Fillet Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, another Abomination within 5 feet of the target regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

action.name: Acid Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/40 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) acid damage, and the target is {@condition poisoned} until the start of Ceemal's next turn.

bonus.name: To Me, Sweetie (3/Day)
entries: Ceemal chooses an ally within 30 feet of them who can hear them. The ally can use their reaction to move up to their speed toward Ceemal without provoking opportunity attacks.

reaction.name: Wail of Loss
entries: When another Abomination who Ceemal can see is reduced to 0 hit points by an enemy within 60 feet of Ceemal, Ceemal releases a psychic wail. The enemy must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Excess can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Excess makes one Bite attack and one Sting attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, they are {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). While {@condition grappled}, a target takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage at the start of each of Excess's turns, and Excess can't make a Bite attack against another target.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

action.name: Swallow
entries: Excess makes a Bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature who they are grappling or hidden from.

If the attack hits, the target is swallowed as Excess enlarges their head and stomach. The swallowed target is no longer {@condition grappled}, but they are {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, have total cover against attacks and other effects outside Excess, and take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of Excess's turns. Excess can have only one target swallowed at a time.
If Excess dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by them and can escape from the corpse by using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Excess takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Klar can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: Klar can mimic animal sounds. A creature who hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: Klar's long jump is up to 40 feet and their high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Klar makes one Bite attack and one Mantis Claws attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Mantis Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 f., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, they are {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). While {@condition grappled} in this way, the target is {@condition restrained}. Moving while grappling a Medium or smaller target doesn't halve Klar's speed. Klar can have only one target {@condition grappled} in this way at a time.

bonus.name: Bellowing Roar (1/Day)
entries: Klar lets loose a terrifying roar.

Each creature within 30 feet of Klar who can hear them must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of Klar for 1 minute. If a creature {@condition frightened} in this way takes damage, they can repeat this saving throw, ending the effect on themself on a success.

bonus.name: Kangaroo Leap
entries: Klar jumps up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: Sair doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when they fly out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Psionic Bolt (1st-Order Power)
entries: {@atk rp} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, they are pushed 5 feet away from Sair.

action.name: *Mind Scream (1/Day; 3rd-Order Power)
entries: Sair psionically pierces the mind of each enemy within 30 feet of them. Each target must make a {@dc 14} Intelligence saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this damage is automatically stabilized.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (3/Day)
entries: When Erasmus makes an attack, he has advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Master Tactician
entries: At the start of a combat encounter, Erasmus chooses when he acts in the initiative order after all other creatures have rolled initiative.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Erasmus makes two Greatsword attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of I'm Right Here.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, they have disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than Erasmus until the end of their next turn.

action.name: I'm Right Here
entries: Erasmus taunts a creature he can see within 5 feet of him who can hear him. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or use their reaction, if available, to attack Erasmus. If the creature attacks, an ally within 30 feet of Erasmus who isn't {@condition incapacitated} can make a weapon attack against the creature (no action required).

action.name: Iron Ring (2/Day)
entries: If not in the Cyst, Erasmus teleports to the Cyst. If in the Cyst, he teleports to a place he has visited.

bonus.name: Mark
entries: Erasmus chooses a creature he can see within 60 feet of him and marks them until the start of his next turn. The first time one of Erasmus's allies deals damage to a marked creature on each turn, the creature takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage.

bonus.name: Reposition
entries: Erasmus and each ally within 60 feet of him who can hear him moves up to 5 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Utility)
headerEntries: In addition to any other spells in this stat block, Athenodorus can cast the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Exploit Opening (3/Day)
entries: When Athenodorus makes an attack, he has advantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Star of Iron
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, they are hexed until the end of their next turn. Whenever a creature hexed in this way makes an attack roll or saving throw, they must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.

action.name: Iron Ring (2/Day)
entries: If not in the Cyst, Athenodorus teleports to the Cyst. If in the Cyst, he teleports to a place he has visited.

action.name: Unholy Fire (2/Day; 3rd-Level Spell)
entries: Athenodorus calls unholy black flames from the depths at a point he can see within 90 feet of him. Each enemy in a 15-foot-radius, 30-foot-high cylinder centered on that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and is moved up to 15 feet horizontally. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't moved.

bonus.name: Blessing of Ajax (2/Day)
entries: Athenodorus chooses a creature he can see within 30 feet of him. The target regains 14 ({@dice 2d8 + 5}) hit points and Athenodorus can end one of the following conditions affecting the target: {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition dazed|FleeMortals}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned}, or {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Exploit Opening (3/Day)
entries: When Cloak makes an attack, she has advantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Cloak makes two Shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage, and the target is {@condition poisoned} until the start of Cloak's next turn.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature who hasn't moved since the end of Cloak's last turn, the attack deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Iron Ring (2/Day)
entries: If not in the Cyst, Cloak teleports to the Cyst. If in the Cyst, she teleports to a place she has visited.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: Cloak takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

reaction.name: You Should've Been Watching Me
entries: If a creature within 5 feet of Cloak hits one of her allies with an attack, Cloak makes a Shortsword attack against the creature. To use this reaction, Cloak must be able to see the ally and the attacker.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Utility)
headerEntries: In addition to any other spells in this stat block, Avalla can cast the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Exploit Opening (3/Day)
entries: When Avalla makes an attack, she has advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Supernatural Resistance
entries: Avalla has advantage on saving throws against powers, spells, and other supernatural effects.

action.name: Lightning Lash (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) lightning damage, and Avalla can move the target up to 15 feet horizontally.

action.name: Iron Terror (1/Day; 4th-Level Spell)
entries: Avalla projects a terrifying illusion of the High Command to each enemy in a 30-foot cone. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} of each member of the High Command for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

action.name: Iron Shackles (1/Day; 3rd-Level Spell; Concentration)
entries: Avalla conjures animated iron chains at a point she can see on the ground within 60 feet of her. The chains fill a 15-foot- square on the ground centered on that point and last for 1 minute. When a creature enters that area for the first time on a turn or starts their turn there, they must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} (save ends at start of turn). A creature {@condition restrained} in this way takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage at the end of each of their turns.
